templateAssets.content:
UC Santa Cruz students may complete one or more minors, provided they can finish all required coursework within their maximum enrollment terms and credit limits. Minors are recorded on the official transcript but do not appear on the diploma. Pursuing a minor is optional and should align with a student’s academic interests and career goals.


Students do not apply for minors as part of their UC Santa Cruz admission application. Transfer students interested in a minor should reach out to the department that offers it for advising during their first quarter of enrollment.

Students majoring in a different program of study may find that a minor in legal studies is an invaluable addition to their educational plan. No prior coursework is required for transfer students interested in this minor. However, transfer students might benefit from completing courses in related fields such as anthropology, art, economics, environmental studies, feminist studies, history, Latin American and Latino studies, literature, music, philosophy, politics, psychology, or sociology.


Please visit the Legal Studies website to learn more about this minor.

UC Santa Cruz General Catalog: Legal Studies Minor Program Statement
